section_a_workflow_definition.q01_workflow_name: new patient intake and appointment scheduling
section_a_workflow_definition.q02_trigger_event: a patient calls to schedule their first appointment
section_a_workflow_definition.q03_business_objective: complete intake paperwork and schedule the first visit within 48 hours for routine care
section_a_workflow_definition.q04_end_condition: Patient completes intake and first appointment is scheduled

section_c_systems_handoffs.q11_manual_data_transfers: manual entry of data from paper form into EHR system

section_d_failure_cost.q13_common_failures: patients not returning intake forms, data entry errors, insurance verification delays
section_d_failure_cost.q14_cost_if_slow_or_failed: approximately $200 in lost revenue per no-show, 2 hours of staff time per patient for manual data entry and verification

section_e_priority.q15_one_thing_to_fix: Automate the intake form delivery and make it digital so patients can fill it out online before their appointment, and automate insurance verification

attachments.notes: About 30% of new patients fail to complete intake within the 48-hour SLA, and about 30% no-show on first appointment due to incomplete paperwork.
